result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elieser Ramos

records.addlTxt:
10:43 AM Defendant Elieser Ramos in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Elieser Ramos.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. Victim's family present in court. 
Report filed. 
Parties have received report and are not contesting report. 
BTC: Defendant is competent to proceed. 
Atty Samuels indicates 22CF328 should be set for trial but the other 2 cases he has not been able to confirm what the defendant wants to do. 
Defendant wishes to address bond today. 
Atty Samuels makes statement as to request. 
State objects to any modification of bond. 
Defendant makes statement. 
** Court removes defendant from courtroom**
Court makes record as to why the defendant was removed. 
State indicates the victim has informed him that the defendant is still contacting the victim through. 
BTC: Matter set over for JT. Bond will not be modified at this time.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 7, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 21, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on February 21, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on February 7, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Competency hearing on September 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Elieser Ramos in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Elieser Ramos. Court Reporter: Saige Smith. Victim present in court. 
Defense raises competency again. 
BTC: Court will order follow up evaluation.
Competency hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Elieser Ramos in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Elieser Ramos. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Alleged victim present in court. NG plea entered.
Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Arraignment on June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:28 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Elieser Ramos in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Elieser Ramos. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Two files scheduled for a preliminary hearing. 
Court will start with case 21CF1526
State asks court take Judicial Notice of prior convictions and felony bond held at time of alleged offense.
Court takes Judicial Notice of prior conviction as well as bond held.
State calls Officer A. Matsen, DSAT
Direct by the State.
Defense on cross.
State moves for bind over.
Defense moves for bind over. 
BTC: Probable cause fund, bound over on all charges.
Court proceeds with prelim on case 22CF328.
State calls Officer Kuiper, DSAT
Direct by the State 
Defendant is escorted out of the hearing room for continuous outbursts. Courts to proceed with hearing without him. 
Defense on cross.
State moves for bind over.
Defense objects.
BTC: Probable cause found, bound over on charges.
Arraignment scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Elieser Ramos in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Elieser Ramos. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Alleged victim appearing via zoom. 
Matter set for contested competency hearing. 
Defense indicates he has obtained a second opinion by Dr. Brost stating that his client is competent. 
Court holds colloquy with defendant about withdrawing request for contested competency hearing. 
Defendant indicates this is false imprisonment and that his called shouldn't be listened to. 
Court proceeds with contested hearing. 
State calls Dr. Grusecki who appears via phone. DSAT. Cross by Defense. 
Nothing further from either party. 
Parties give argument. 
BTC: Defendant is competent. 21CF1526 & 22CF328 will be set for prelim. 
Defendant indicates the city is after him and his family. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Elieser Ramos in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Elieser Ramos. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense indicates this defendant has competency hearing scheduled in another file, would like that determined before proceeding. Defense requests to address bond.
BTC: court raises competency in this file and sets it to track with pending files, will not order a new evaluation since one has been ordered on pending files. Bond will not be heard, victim notice was not given.
Competency hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Competency hearing on May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Charges per attached amended criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim V.C (person, property, residence or family).

2:03 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Elieser Ramos appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson appeared by video for Elieser Ramos. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Victim V.C appears via zoom.
Amended complaint has been filed adding more charges.
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.

Status conference on April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
